items.sentence: Tom told me that he thought that he might be able to do that.
I suspect Tom knows that Mary doesn't live in Boston anymore.
I suspect Tom and Mary were planning on doing that yesterday.
I suspect Tom and Mary want us to help them do that tomorrow.
I suspect that Tom won't tell Mary why he's going to do that.
I suspect that Tom is likely to do that while he's in Boston.
I suspect that Tom and Mary don't speak French to each other.
I suspect that Tom and Mary aren't going to do that together.
I suspect that Tom and Mary aren't able to do that very well.
I don't think that anybody really thought that Tom was happy.
I don't think that Tom had anything to do with what happened.
I think there's a good chance that we'll never see Tom again.
I don't think Tom knows what time Mary wants him to meet her.
I don't think that Tom is going to go to Australia with Mary.
I don't think that you'll be able to persuade Tom to do that.
I don't think that Tom would try to do that without our help.
I don't think that Tom would mind showing you how to do that.
I told Tom that it would be better if he didn't get involved.
Tom told Mary that you'd finished the work three days before.
If you have to say that you're smart, are you actually smart?
